Remember to log in to complete your tasks regularly! Pairing... Dr. Macro Francesco Scanning... Task expired Turn on your mobile device\'s Bluetooth to pair device. Bluetooth not found Record your cough by holding your phone away from your coughing direction. Record a short speech in your normal speaking volume. Do take note if you do not have any cough, please do not forcefully cough. Follow this sample passage: When I woke up this morning, I looked out the window and saw the sun. That made me want to get up and get started with the day. So I went to the kitchen and made some tea. And some toast. And  then I turned on the radio. Tap to play your speech recording To record, PRESS and HOLD \n THE BUTTON To stop recording,\nRELEASE THE BUTTON Recording… Record again Record manually instead How to measure Ensure your mobile device\'s Bluetooth is on. Ensure the cuff is level with your heart. Press the Power button on the monitor to start the measurement. Once measurement is done, wait for 15 seconds for the readings to appear here. Step on your weighing scale to begin recording automatically. Step on your weighing scale. Stand still until the display stops blinking. Weight and BMI readings will appear. If there’s nothing displayed on the screen, check if the batteries need to be replaced. Stand still until the display stops blinking and weight reading appears. If there’s no display, please check if batteries need replacement. Ensure your mobile device\'s Bluetooth is on. With your palm facing up, slide your middle or index finger completely into the oximeter as shown above. Wait for 10 seconds until the reading on the oximeter screen becomes stable and remove your finger. Press and hold the Power button on the monitor for 2 seconds to pair your device. How to pair your Welch Allyn Home™\nBP Monitor How to pair your Welch Allyn Home™ Scale How to pair your FORA TN’G Voice How to pair your NoninConnect™ Pulse Oximeter 3230 The device may take slightly longer to connect. Tap to play your cough recording… Welch Allyn HomeTM Blood Pressure Monitor 1500 Welch Allyn HomeTM Blood Pressure Monitor 1700 Make sure your mobile device\'s Bluetooth is on. Ensure your mobile device\'s Bluetooth is on. Press the Power button at the back of the scale once until the display lights up. Slide your middle or index finger completely into the oximeter as shown above. A white Bluetooth icon will appear on the oximeter screen. Press and hold the same button for 3 seconds to pair your device. The Bluetooth icon will flash while pairing. The device may take slightly longer to connect. 00.0 000.0 00 000 kg lb \u2109 % Take: Notes: Frequency: Start Date: Stop Date: Tap the respective boxes below to enter your\nblood pressure and resting heart rate manually. BP cuff is not connected. Searching for BP device... BP cuff is now connected. Just a moment while we set it up for you. \nThank you for your patience. Would you like to connect your\nBP cuff to record automatically? Start Receiving blood pressure readings from your connected BP cuff... How to measure Please maintain the BP cuff at the same level with your heart or adjust the angle of your elbow between 20° and 30°. Example: Current angle of your elbow: Capturing your reading... Confirm BP cuff readings Try again? Step 1: Wear your BP cuff on your wrist\nStep 2: Press the Start/Stop button on your BP cuff Wear your connected BP cuff and tap the Start button below to begin recording automatically. Instructions Always charge your BP cuff before use and \nmake sure your mobile device\'s Bluetooth is turned on. You can try connecting your BP cuff again to record automatically.
OR

Your Everion® device is connected. "Are you sure you want to skip? " BLE is not supported on this device. How to pair your Everion® How to pair your EmbracePlus How to update firmware Turn on Everion® by placing it on the charger. Make sure it is charged. Remove Everion® from the charger. Blinking blue light at the back of the device indicates that it is ready to connect. Ensure your phone’s Bluetooth is on. Tap the red banner on the app’s Today Screen to start pairing your Everion®. Constant blue light indicates that device is successfully paired. Wear Everion® on your arm. In your app Settings, find “Devices” and select the device to update. Select “Update firmware” and complete the installation. Go to your phone Settings and find the Bluetooth option. You will see the paired Everion® device ID. Tap on the settings icon beside it. Tap on “Forget” or “Unpair”, and confirm. Go back to Bluetooth, wait for the Everion® device ID to appear again. Confirm pairing request. It will only take a few seconds Searching for Everion® Searching for Nonin™ Everion® device is not connected. Dosage: Frequency: Start: Stop: Notes:\t %1$d times daily Accepted Rejected Valid range: %1$s Valid range: 89.6 - 107.6 °F Valid range: 32 - 42 °C Valid range: 91.4 - 105.8 °F Valid range: 33 - 41 °C Functionality limited This app needs location access Please grant location access so this app can detect BLE devices. Since location access has not been granted, this app will not be able to discover BLE devices. Your BLE devices will be connected while you’re in the app. However, the functionality might be limited. It’s recommended that you select “Allow all the time” to have full functionality of BLE devices. Accessing location in background You can enable location permissions later by navigating to Settings > Apps and notifications > Biofourmis Care Patient™ > Permissions > Location You can opt out background location permission by selecting “Allow only while using the app”. However, some functionality of BLE devices (wearable Bluetooth devices) will be limited, e.g. reconnecting to an already paired wearable device might fail while the app is in the background. TM Recorded blood oxygen level Discontinued No discontinued medications yet °C °F Vitals last updated: 📹 Video Call with care team Help Last synced: Took medications Take medications How to pair your VitalPatch® How to use your Everion+ Prepare upper-left chest Clean your upper left chest with alcohol wipe and leave the area to dry. If there is body hair over the area, please shave to remove it before cleaning and applying the device. Power ON your VitalPatch® Remove the VitalPatch® from the pouch. On a flat surface, press the power button on the patch once. A green light will appear flashing on the logo side for a while. VitalPatch® will remain in searching mode. Applying your VitalPatch® Space two fingers below the dip at the base of your neck. Position diagonally with the three lines angled downward away from the midline. Remove the adhesive backings (Do not discard yet) and firmly press down both sides to adhere to the skin. Pulse oximeter NoninConnect™ Pulse Oximeter 3230 FORA Test N’GO Voice VitalPatch® is monitoring your vitals VitalPatch® is disconnected Skip this step Forget VitalPatch®? Forget EmbracePlus? You’ll need to pair your device again to use it next time. Vital Patch® Avg. steps Body temp. range Avg. body temperature Avg. blood oxygen level Nonin Nonin 3230 Respiratory rate 99999 unit Do you really want to logout? Last synced 30 Aug 2019 Device status VitalPatch battery is critical VitalPatch® device is not connected. Monitoring devices are not connected. EmbracePlus devices are not connected. Medications Your Vitalpatch will run out of battery in sometime. Please use a new one to continue Everion+ Device id: Device id: \n %s Turn on Everion+ by attaching the charger onto it. Make sure it is fully charged, indicated by constant green light at the back of the device. Remove Everion+ from the charger. The green light starts to blink and the device goes to standby mode. Blue light appears when Everion+ is connected to the cloud network. Red light indicates a device fault. In this case, contact support. Wear Everion+ on your arm. The device detects it is being worn and starts to measure your vitals. When the battery is low or in standby state for 5 minutes, Everion+ goes to sleep. All lights will be turned off and data syncing will pause. To wake it up, charge or wear the device. 5 Lifelong learning Discover insightful health related content, compiled just for you. See education content Stay tuned for new education content. Coming soon Guidelines for Controlling \nSodium Activity No activity Searching for VitalPatch® It may take some time. Blood glucose reading saved Last recorded: %1$s\nBlood glucose level: %2$s mmol/L Last recorded: %1$s\nBlood glucose level: %2$s mg/dL Slide the Bluetooth button on the right side upwards as shown, until a blue light starts to flash at the top left. Ensure your mobile device\'s Bluetooth is on. Stay on this screen for device list to appear. Start with your glucometer turned off. Insert a test strip to turn it on. The screen will then display “ @ “. Ensure your mobile device\'s Bluetooth is on. On the meter, a solid blue light will appear once device is connected. Puncture your finger with the lancing device. Gently bring the meter with the strip to the blood sample. Stay put until you hear a beep sound. Wait for 7 seconds for the reading to appear here. You may eject and dispose the test strip afterwards. Start with your glucometer turned off. Insert a test strip to turn it on. The screen will display "Gen" and a flashing icon - @ Ensure your mobile device’s Bluetooth is on. On the meter, a solid blue light will appear once device is connected. Puncture your finger with the lancing device. Gently bring the meter with the strip to the blood sample. Stay put until you hear a beep sound. Wait for the meter to count down to 0 before tapping on \"Connect now\". The reading will appear on the app. Alternatively, tap on \"Record manually instead\" to manually input the reading. You may eject and dispose the test strip afterwards. Before meal After meal Fasting 12:20 PM 144 mg/dL Blood glucose level information Immediately before a meal 1-2 hours after a meal 8-12 hours of no food and water Fora Care® Searching for iThermonitor™ Select your iThermonitor™ to connect Next, connect your iThermonitor™.\n Make sure it’s charged and turned on before pairing. How to pair your iThermonitor™ Make sure your mobile device\'s Bluetooth is on. iThermonitor should power on automatically with the indicator light blinking. If not blinking, long press the device button for 2 seconds or more. Place iThermonitor in the center of the adhesive patch with the metal probe facing up. Apply device under your armpit. Make sure the metal probe is in contact with the skin. Searching for iThermonitor™ device… Searching for iThermonitor™ … iThermonitor™ device is not connected. iThermonitor™ No iThermonitor™ found You’ll need to pair your device again to use it next time. iThermonitor™ Forget iThermonitor™? iThermonitor™ found Select your device to connect iThermonitor™ connected Your device has been paired successfully. Make sure your device is in range and\n turned on. To keep your patch adhesive, hold your arm for 8 minutes after applying. Please grant storage permission iThermonitor™ is not connected iThermonitor™ is monitoring your body temperature Permission required Default message OK Care team is not available iThermonitor™ device Heart rate & respiration rate Some permissions are missing and needed for the proper functionality of the app. Please go to Settings -> Apps -> Biofourmis -> Permissions and enable these permissions: Missing permissions Permissions needed In the following screen, please grant permission to: Location Access location on this device Phone Receive video calls from your care team Notifications Receive notifications and important updates Nearby devices Find, connect to, and determine the relative position of nearby devices In the following screen, grant permission to access location on this device. // Translation required Chart information Normal High Low intensity High intensity Elevated bed angle 30° Supine bed is flat Calling Select posture Your medications are currently still active. Choose to continue with your default mobile device language setting or select another language for this app. Language changed You can now use the app in your preferred language. The above graph shows your before meal, after meal, and fasting blood glucose levels hour by hour. Select time of checking: Could not connect to iThermonitor™. Please check device is within range and turned on Connect now Select time video audio Avg. resting heart rate // Used google translator Video Link is not valid AM PM How to pair your Welch Allyn Home™ Scale How to measure Ensure your mobile device\'s Bluetooth is on. Find the “Record weight” task on the app’s Today screen. Press the Power button at the back of the scale once until the display lights up. Press and hold the same button for 3 seconds to pair your device. The Bluetooth icon will flash while pairing. Tap on “Pair now” on the app. Wait for the pairing to complete. The scale will turn off automatically when it’s not in use. Step on your weighing scale to begin recording automatically. Stand still until the display stops blinking and weight reading appears. If there’s no display, please check if batteries need replacement. Wait for this reading to appear on the app. Alternatively, tap on “Record manually instead” to manually input the reading. 6 How to pair your Welch Allyn Home™ BP Monitor Find the “Record blood pressure” task on the app’s Today screen. Press and hold the Power button on the monitor for 2 seconds to pair your device. Wait for the pairing to complete. The monitor will turn off automatically when it’s not in use. Ensure the cuff is level with your heart. Find the “Record blood pressure” task on the app’s Today screen. Press the Power button on the monitor to start the measurement. Once measurement is done, wait for 15 seconds for the readings to appear on the app. Alternatively, tap on “Record manually instead” to manually input the readings. How to pair your NoninConnect™ Pulse Oximeter 3230 A white Bluetooth icon @ will appear on the oximeter screen. Find the “Record blood oxygen level” task on the app’s Today screen. The app will scan for devices. Select your device and tap “Connect”. Slide your middle or index finger completely into the oximeter as shown above. The oximeter should be switched on automatically. Wait for the pairing to complete. Remove your finger. The oximeter will turn off automatically in a few seconds. With your palm facing up, slide your middle or index finger completely into the oximeter as shown above. The oximeter should be switched on automatically. Find the “Record blood oxygen level” task on the app’s Today screen. Wait for 10 seconds until the reading on the oximeter screen becomes stable and remove your finger. Wait for this reading to appear on the app. Alternatively, tap on “Record manually instead” to manually input the reading. How to pair your FORA TN’G Voice The glucometer will turn off automatically when it’s not in use. The device list will appear on the app. Select your device ID and proceed to connect. Slide the Bluetooth button on the right side upwards as shown, until a blue light starts to flash at the top left. Start with your glucometer turned off. Insert a test strip to turn it on. The screen will display “Gen” and a flashing icon - @ Ensure your mobile device\'s Bluetooth is on. On the meter, a solid blue light will appear once device is connected. Puncture your finger with the lancing device. Gently bring the meter with the strip to the blood sample. Stay put until you hear a beep sound. Wait for the meter to count down to 0 before tapping on “Connect now”. The reading will appear on the app. Alternatively, tap on “Record manually instead” to manually input the reading. Eject and dispose the test strip. Upcoming Routine As needed (optional) time daily times daily Dose: Strength: Take qty: Today\'s plan Action needed Changes in %1$s Answer a few questions about your recent experience. In the following screen, grant permission to access camera all the time on this device. Allow access to camera on your device Important questions This questionnaire is no longer available. Today’s completed tasks You’ve not completed any tasks yet. BLE Hardware is required but not available! Go to Permissions to allow location access all the time. In your mobile device Settings, find Biofourmis Care Patient™ app. Evaluation expired // Translation required QR login What is QR login? It is a secure, fuss-free way of logging into the Biofourmis Care Patient™mobile app. Scan the QR code provided by your clinician. or Import from gallery Turn on torchlight if it is too dark Scan QR code xx-xxx-xx-xx-xxx-xx We don’t recognise this QR code Ensure this image you’re scanning is a valid QR code and try to reposition it under better lighting. Show %1$s others Show less "App is running" How to pair your Omron™ HEM-7600T \nBP Monitor Ensure your mobile device\'s Bluetooth is on. Ensure the monitor screen is blank. Press and hold the connection button “⇋” until P is shown on it. The BP monitor will start scanning for devices. Ensure the cuff is level with your heart. Press the START/STOP button on the monitor to start the measurement. Once measurement is done, press the connection button “⇋” on the monitor to transfer your readings to the app. Omron™ HEM-7600T BP Monitor found Select your device ID to connect failure In the following screens, grant permission to access Bluetooth and location on this device. You won’t be able to discover Bluetooth devices. Please grant permission to access them. Allow access to Bluetooth on your device Go to Bluetooth and turn it on. This device was previously unpaired by you. Please unpair and connect if you were trying to connect to a different device Device ID: %1$s Ensure the monitor screen is blank. Press and hold the connection button “⇋” until P appears. The app will scan for devices. Select your device and tap on “Connect”. To turn off the monitor, press the START/STOP button again. Otherwise, the monitor will automatically turn off after 2 minutes. Press the START/STOP button on the monitor to start the measurement. Once measurement is done, press the connection button “⇋“ on the monitor to transfer your readings to the app. Alternatively, tap on “Record manually instead” to manually input the readings. It’s best to take your respiratory rate while sitting up in a chair or in bed. Measure your breathing rate by counting the number of times your chest or abdomen rises over the course of one minute. V.ALRT is connected V.ALRT is disconnected Pairing V.Alrt Searching for V.ALRT V.ALRT connected How to pair your V.ALRT Ensure your mobile device\'s Bluetooth is turned on. Press and hold the V.ALRT button for 10 to 15 seconds until the device beeps and flashes green. Tap on the Search button below to search for devices. Your V.ALRT device ID should appear on the screen shortly. Select it to connect. Search V.ALRT found Select your device ID to connect. Select device to connect Your device has been paired successfully Find the V.ALRT device status card on the app’s Today screen, then tap on the Search button. Your V.ALRT device ID should appear on the screen shortly. Select it to connect. Place your mobile device near you to ensure that the V.ALRT button remains connected. In an event of an emergency, press and hold the button for 3 seconds. A beep sound will be heard. If the V.ALRT button beeps and flashes red, place your mobile device nearer to the device and check that your mobile device\'s Bluetooth is turned on. Once in range, the button flashes green and beeps once. Every time you activate the V.ALRT button, a record will be entered into the app\'s Activity log. How to use Replace your device\'s batteries to continue using it. Device ID: V.Alrt button pressed and sent successfully Record ECG This feature is not supported yet Your recording will be sent to your care team. AliveCor® %d bpm 1-lead 6-lead Recorded ECG Pair a device Powered by AliveCor About AliveCor SDK Android SDK App version 1.4.0 SDK App Part number 002012 KardiaAI and UM version KAIv1: 1.3.0\nUM: 1.3.1 FCCID 2ASFFAC019 CE Mark number 0123 ECG collection and analysis functionalities are developed and maintained by AliveCor, Inc. How to connect your KardiaMobile 6L ECG device Ensure your mobile device’s Bluetooth is turned on. Your mobile device should not be charging. Find Record ECG on the app’s Today screen, then select Find my device. Place your mobile device near you and rest your fingers on the top two metal electrodes of the ECG device. The app will detect the Bluetooth signal from the ECG device, then automatically connect. The connection process should take no more than a few seconds. Ensure the electrodes of the ECG device are clean. Repeat Steps 1 and 2 above. Sitting down, place your mobile device near you and put the ECG device on the bare skin of your left knee or ankle. Rest 2 or more fingers lightly on the top two electrodes with the A logo facing up. Hold this position for 30 seconds until the recording is completed. Adapted from KardiaMobile 6L user manual by AliveCor User manual ECG device KardiaMobile 6L by AliveCor® Device name Information Recording is incorrect and won\'t be saved. Please record again. Press and hold SET on the scale for 5 seconds until the Bluetooth symbol appears and starts to flash. Tap on “Pair now” on the app. Wait for pairing to complete. FORA W550 FORA™ W550 Weight Scale Welch Allyn Home™ Scale 100 Ensure your phone’s Bluetooth is turned on. Find the “Record weight” task on the app’s Today screen. Step on your weighing scale. Stand still until the display stops blinking. Weight and BMI readings will appear. If there’s nothing displayed on the screen, check if the batteries need to be replaced. Wait for your weight to appear on the app. Alternatively, tap on “Record manually instead” to manually input. Call now? The care team member appears to be offline. The care team will be informed that you have confirmed your upcoming lab tes Recommended Lab: Hi doctor, I’ve got questions on acknowledging Hi doctor, I’ve got questions on confirming the completion of Weighing scale list Take FVC breathing test Spirometer Zephyrx™ Spirometer Zephyrx Spirometer Take FVC breathing test How to connect and use your Zephyrx Spirometer Ensure your phone’s Bluetooth is on. Find Take FVC breathing test under Today’s tasks on this app. You will be prompted to open the Zephyrx Breathe Easy app to complete the task. The Zephyrx app will detect the Bluetooth signal from the spirometer device, then automatically connect. Do not share your spirometer with others as the Zephyrx app submits readings automatically to the care team. This task will be marked as completed on this app once your reading is received. This may take a while. Date and time Date and\n time FVC (L) FEV1 (L) FEV1/FVC Proceed to the Zephyrx Breathe Easy app to complete this task. All readings taken on the Zephryx app will be submitted automatically to your care team. \n\n Once your reading is received, it may take a while for the task to be marked as completed. Open Zephyrx Breathe Easy app Error messages may appear on iBloodPressure monitor Do not share your iBloodPressure device with others as the device submits readings automatically to the care team.\n\nOnce your reading is received, it may take a while for the task to be marked as completed. Once the measurement is taken, you will see the systolic, diastolic and heart rate readings on the monitor. Wait until the display shows ‘OK’. This means that the reading is recorded and transmitted successfully. Read more Video call participant is currently not available By care team Record weight has been marked as completed Record blood pressure has been marked as completed Questionnaire already completed Your care team has already answered this questionnaire on your behalf. iPulseOx Pulse oximeter Do not share your iPulseOx device with others as readings will be submitted automatically to the care team.\n\nOnce your readings are received, it may take a while for the task to be marked as completed. iPulseOx™ Cellular Oximeter Press the white button to turn on the oximeter. Insert your index or middle finger completely into the oximeter as shown above. The Blood oxygen level reading will appear on the OLED screen within 30 seconds. Wait until the OLED displays “Goodbye”. This means that the readings are recorded and transmitted successfully. How to use your iPulseOx Cellular Oximeter To complete the Record blood oxygen level task, go to the task on the app\’s Today screen and follow the instructions. Otherwise, continue to Step 2. Press the white button to turn on the oximeter. Insert your index or middle finger completely into the oximeter as shown above. The blood oxygen level and heart rate readings will appear on the OLED screen within 30 seconds. Wait until the OLED displays “Goodbye”. This means that the readings are recorded and transmitted successfully. This task will be marked as completed once your readings are received. This may take a while. * Error messages may appear on iPulseOx oximeter. Endometriosis Care Onboarding completed Congratulations, you have started endometriosis care program. Turn off device Place the EmbracePlus on your wrist Wear it on your non dominant hand for more accurate monitoring.Your EmbracePlus should be a finger’s width from your wrist bone. Adjust the band fit Insert the band inside the loop and pull until you feel a soft pressure on you wrist.Make sure it doesn’t easily change position. Fasten the band Slide the tail of the band through the loop to secure it in position. Be aware a loose band will affect monitoring. EmbracePlus EmbracePlus should be turned on On the back of EmbracePlus Keep it close to this device Make sure its’s not connected to another device The EmbracePlus serial number can be found at the bottom of the EmbracePlus pod, near by the sensors. Keep EmbracePlus (even if in charger) close to this device so it make it easily discoverable by the Biofourmis™ Care App. If EmbracePlus and this device are touching your watch should be the first listed in case more wearable are found. In order to pair EmbracePlus to this device, EmbracePlus must not be connected with another device. To check this, when out of the charger, check if the Empatica heart is visible on EmbracePlus. If this is the case, you first need to unpair (forget) it on its companion device (go to the settings page on the companion device). The EmbracePlus serial number can be found at the bottom of the EmbracePlus pod, near by the sensors. On the side box label Device battery low Check the EmbracePlus box there’s label, the serial number is printed at the center of the label. You should see a green user LED show indicating that it is now on.Locate charging pins on the bottom of the module.Connect USB-C Magnetic Charging cable to the charging pins. You should make sure they are aligned properly.Once connected, you should see the Status LED change colors. Blinking green indicates charging. Solid green means it is fully charged.The device should be worn with the module on the top of the wrist. See pictures below.For best results, here are some tips:1. Wear device snug just enough where it does not slide around your wrist. but not so tight that you cannot put a finger inside the strap.2. Place the device about 1 finger length away from your ulnar bone as shown below. It should NOT be resting on your bone.Double press the button. You will see the user LED flash a color for 1 second.
